page.title: 03FISH FARMING ON THE FIRTH
page.content: cont. Ross, the assistant. took us out to the fish farm in their boat from Cromarty Harbour. It was a lovely day and it was an interesting trip s there were several vessels as well as some oil rigs out in the firth. The farm consists of large rectangular cages made of wood,bolted together with huge metal bolts, with a net suspended from each one. At present, there are seven cages, all linked together, but the firm plan to add another four cages shortly. We walked round the wooden catwalks surrounding the cages and were able to see the trout and salmon,about 17000 of them. We saw the big funnel shaped bins,suspended over each cage which automatically tilt at regulat intervals, to feed the fish cont.
